snippet: The question of precisely what legal status and protections should be granted to gay couples is emerging as an issue of the sharpest possible contrast between the two presidential candidates.
abstract: Mitt Romney reaffirms his belief that marriage should be restricted to heterosexual couples following Pres Obama's endorsement of marriage equality; Romney's language leaves open many questions about what his vision of legally recognizable gay unions would encompass.
lead_paragraph: The question of precisely what legal status and protections should be granted to gay couples is emerging as an issue of the sharpest possible contrast between the two presidential candidates.

headline.main: Romney Reaffirms Opposition to Marriage, or Unions, for Gay Couples
headline.print_headline: Romney Reaffirms Opposition to Marriage, or Unions, for Gay Couples

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
